summary: This bill, the William Lacy Clay Sr. Memorial Stamp Act, calls for the Postmaster General to issue a commemorative postage stamp honoring William Lacy Clay Sr. The bill highlights Clay Sr.'s life and career, including his service in the U.S. Army, his 32 years in the House of Representatives, and his work on civil rights, voting rights, and labor legislation. It details his founding membership in the Congressional Black Caucus and his impact on landmark legislation.
